name: 張秉宸
objective: This course aims to explore advanced topics in production operations and control systems, further analyze application cases of operations management in the manufacturing industry, and examine how technologies such as AI, IoT, and cloud computing are integrated into production systems—thereby enabling students to gain a more in-depth understanding of operations system management and apply it to their own research topics.
schedule:
Week 1:      Introduction to Operations Management  
Weeks 2–3:   Forecasting  
Weeks 4–5:   Paper Presentation I: Advanced Forecasting Techniques  
Week 6:      Capacity Planning for Products  
Week 7:      Process Selection and Facility Layout  
Weeks 8–9:   Paper Presentation II: Automation in the Modern Factory  
Week 10:     Location Planning and Analysis  
Weeks 11–12: Quality Management  
Weeks 13–14: Paper Presentation III: What AI Can Do in Quality Management?  
Weeks 15–16: JIT and Lean Operations  
Weeks 17–18: Paper Presentation IV: How Do You Apply Operations Research in Your Research?
scorePolicy:
Class Participation 30%
Paper Presentation 30%
Final Presentation 40%
materials: Stevenson／Operations and Supply Chain Management (2024 Release)／15e
consultation: Students may contact me by Email.pcchang@ntut.edu.tw
課程對應SDGs指標: SDG12：負責任的消費與生產（Responsible Consumption and Production）
課程是否導入AI: ● 鼓勵學生使用生成式 AI 工具（Encourage students to use generative AI tools）
